revised_title: Periglacial Landforms and Environmental Changes in Ireland During the Devensian Cold Stage
tldr: This study examines the environmental conditions in Ireland during the Devensian Cold Stage, focusing on periglacial features and the influence of frost cycles. The research suggests that two frost cycles occurred during this period, with the first being very severe and the second shorter and sharper. The findings provide insights into the formation of periglacial landforms and the complex interactions between ice masses and periglacial conditions.
